18#include "ODUPCEANReader.h"
19
20#include <array>
21#include <cstddef>
22#include <stdexcept>
23#include <string>
24
25namespace ZXing {
26namespace OneD {
27
28class UPCEANCommon
29{
30public:
31 /**
32 * Start/end guard pattern.
33 */
34 static const std::array<int, 3> START_END_PATTERN;
35
36 /**
37 * "Odd", or "L" patterns used to encode UPC/EAN digits.
38 */
39 static const std::array<UPCEANReader::Digit, 10> L_PATTERNS;
40
41 /**
42 * Pattern marking the middle of a UPC/EAN pattern, separating the two halves.
43 */
44 static const std::array<int, 5> MIDDLE_PATTERN;
45
46 /**
47 * As above but also including the "even", or "G" patterns used to encode UPC/EAN digits.
48 */
49 static const std::array<UPCEANReader::Digit, 20> L_AND_G_PATTERNS;
50
51 /**
52 * UPCE end guard pattern (== MIDDLE_PATTERN + single module black bar)
53 */
54 static const std::array<int, 6> UPCE_END_PATTERN;
55
56 /**
57 * See {@link #L_AND_G_PATTERNS}; these values similarly represent patterns of
58 * even-odd parity encodings of digits that imply both the number system (0 or 1)
59 * used (index / 10), and the check digit (index % 10).
60 */
61 static const std::array<int, 20> NUMSYS_AND_CHECK_DIGIT_PATTERNS;
62
63 template <typename T>
64 static int ComputeChecksum(const std::basic_string<T>& digits, bool skipTail = false)
65 {
66 int sum = 0, N = Size(digits);
67 for (int i = N - 1 - skipTail; i >= 0; i -= 2) {
68 sum += digits[i] - '0';
69 }
70 sum *= 3;
71 for (int i = N - 2 - skipTail; i >= 0; i -= 2) {
72 sum += digits[i] - '0';
73 }
74 return (10 - (sum % 10)) % 10;
75 }
76
77 template <size_t N, typename T>
78 static std::array<int, N> DigitString2IntArray(const std::basic_string<T>& in, int checksum = -1)
79 {
80 static_assert(N == 8 || N == 13, "invalid UPC/EAN length");
81
82 if (in.size() != N && in.size() != N-1)
83 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid input string length");
84
85 std::array<int, N> out = {};
86 for (size_t i = 0; i < in.size(); ++i) {
87 out[i] = in[i] - '0';
88 if (out[i] < 0 || out[i] > 9)
89 throw std::invalid_argument("Contents must contain only digits: 0-9");
90 }
91
92 if (checksum == -1)
93 checksum = ComputeChecksum(in, N == in.size());
94
95 if (in.size() == N-1)
96 out.back() = checksum;
97 else if (out.back() != checksum)
98 throw std::invalid_argument("Checksum error");
99
100 return out;
101 }
102
103 /**
104 * Expands a UPC-E value back into its full, equivalent UPC-A code value.
105 *
106 * @param upce UPC-E code as string of digits
107 * @return equivalent UPC-A code as string of digits
108 */
109 template <typename StringT>
110 static StringT ConvertUPCEtoUPCA(const StringT& upce)
111 {
112 if (upce.length() < 7)
113 return upce;
114
115 auto upceChars = upce.substr(1, 6);
116
117 StringT result;
118 result.reserve(12);
119 result += upce[0];
120 auto lastChar = upceChars[5];
121 switch (lastChar) {
122 case '0':
123 case '1':
124 case '2':
125 result += upceChars.substr(0, 2);
126 result += lastChar;
127 result += StringT(4, '0');
128 result += upceChars.substr(2, 3);
129 break;
130 case '3':
131 result += upceChars.substr(0, 3);
132 result += StringT(5, '0');
133 result += upceChars.substr(3, 2);
134 break;
135 case '4':
136 result += upceChars.substr(0, 4);
137 result += StringT(5, '0');;
138 result += upceChars[4];
139 break;
140 default:
141 result += upceChars.substr(0, 5);
142 result += StringT(4, '0');
143 result += lastChar;
144 break;
145 }
146 // Only append check digit in conversion if supplied
147 if (upce.length() >= 8) {
148 result += upce[7];
149 }
150 return result;
151 }
152};
153
154} // OneD
155} // ZXing
